value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: In the atributive position adjectives do not agree, in the autonomous use they do agree.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: A small part of adjectives is non-derived. Non-derived adjectives do not change. A larger part of adjectives are derived: they contain the adjectivizer -t:u-CL and agree in gender and number
example_as_in_source: hibat̅u dija, hibat̅ur buwa, hibat̅ib lobur
example: hibat:u dija, hibat:ur buwa, hibat:ib lobur
translation_as_in_source: хороший отец, хорошая мать, хорошие дети
translation: good father, good mother, good children
gloss: good-attr-m father, good-attr-f mother, good-attr-pl child-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives can be used in attributive and predicative functions. In both functions they do not agree with the noun(s) in number and case.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives have a short and a long form. The short form is restricted in its use. All adjectives in their long form have gender agreement suffixes, which in plural neutralize in -l. Besides, some adjectival stems have gender-number prefixes regardless of the short / full form distinction; these in plural are neutralized as r-.
example_as_in_source: w-icata-w či, r-icata-l čaʕi. j-icata-j č’užu, r-icata-l ručːabi. b-icata-b t’ex, r-icata-l t’axal
example: w-itsata-w tʃi, r-itsata-l tʃaʕi. j-itsata-j tʃ’užu, r-itsata-l rutʃːabi. b-itsata-b t’ex, r-itsata-l t’axal
translation_as_in_source: fat man, fat men. fat woman, fat women. thick book, thick books
translation: fat man, fat men. fat woman, fat women. thick book, thick books
gloss: M-fat-M man, PL-fat-PL man.PL. F-fat-F woman, F-fat-F woman.PL. N-fat-N book, PL-fat-PL book.PL

value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: I very tentatively proposed in Zakirova (2023) that -ba in HPL may be segmented as -b (HPL) and -a (-PL). However, I find it too dubious an idea to put it on the map
example_as_in_source: w=aharu=w ima, j=aharu=j ila, b=etʃ’atu=b zin, b=aharu=ba imari, r=etʃ’atu=r zin-a
example: w=aharu=w ima, j=aharu=j ila, b=etʃ’atu=b zin, b=aharu=ba imari, r=etʃ’atu=r zin-a
translation_as_in_source: старый отец, старая мать, черная корова, старые родители, черные коровы
translation: old father, old mother, black cow, old parents, black cows
gloss: m=old=m father, f=old=f mother, n=black=n cow, hpl=old=hpl parents, npl=black=npl cow-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Most of the adjectives attach specialized number agreement markers, but there are also several (about twenty) adjectives that do not agree in number
example_as_in_source: хъуссо гьино, хъуссā гьинода. хъимā водо, хъимā водбо
example: qχus:o hino, qχus:a: hinoda. qχimā wodo, qχimā wodbo
translation_as_in_source: узкая дорога, узкие дороги. пасмурный день, пасмурные дни
translation: narrow road, narrow roads. cloudy day, cloudy days
gloss: narrow road, narrow.pl road-pl. cloudy day, cloudy day.pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: There is a plural agreement suffix, present both in direct and indirect cases. Examples don't show it but judging by the text the adnominal position is meant
example_as_in_source: ħäld-iy-ö DIR SG; ħäld-iy-ärö DIR PL
example: ħæld-ij-ö DIR SG ‘white’; ħæld-ij-ærø DIR PL

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Gender markers of animate nouns change to re- and -l. There are also instances of suppletion: SG zuk':u, PL k'anc':il ('small'). Adjectives without the gender marker do not agree with the plural head by means of gender markers but some adjectives in plural attach -l.
example_as_in_source: SG вечIуха -- PL речIуха, речIуха-л адамал. SG зукIкIу -- PL кIанцIцIил
example: SG w-etʃ'uχa -- PL r-etʃ'uχa, r-etʃ'uχa-l adamal. Suppletion: SG zuk':u, PL k'anc':il
translation_as_in_source: большой -- большие, старшие люди. Маленький -- маленькие
translation: big (m) -- big (hpl), older people. Little (sg) -- little (pl)
gloss: m-big -- pl-big, pl-big-pl man-pl. small.sg -- small.pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives in the attributive position do not change, and when substantivized they do change

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives in the attributive position have separate agreement in gender and number
example_as_in_source: SG ару (m), арв-и (f), ару-б (n1), ару-л (n2), арв-и (n3), PL ару-б-е (hpl), арв-и-йе (npl)
example: SG aru (m), arv-i (f), aru-b (n1), aru-l (n2), arv-i (n3), PL aru-b-e (hpl), arv-i-je (npl)
gloss: SG broad.m, broad-f, broad-n1, broad-n2, broad-n3, PL broad-hpl-pl, broad-npl-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives in the attributive (dependent) position do not change, and when substantivized (independent) they do change. However, there are a handful of adjectives with a plural form: small, big, low, firm, yellow, strong
example_as_in_source: цӏиэн байракх, цӏиэн байракхаш. воккха кӏант, баккхий кӏентий.
example: ts'ien bajrakχ, ts'ien bajrakχaʃ. wokːχa k'ant, bakːχij k'entij
translation_as_in_source: красное знамя, красные знамена. большой парень, большие парни.
translation: red banner, red banners. big guy, big guys.
gloss: red banner, red banner-pl. m-big guy, hpl-big-pl guy-pl.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: A few adjectives agree in number by changing root vocalism

comment: Adjectives do not agree for the new plural, but they do agree for the old plural (-n-i)
example_as_in_source: maġal-i brma kal-i, maġal-i brma kal-eb-i. maġal-i brma kal-i, maġal-n-i brma-n-i kal-n-i
example: maġal-i brma kal-i, maġal-i brma kal-eb-i. maġal-i brma kal-i, maġal-n-i brma-n-i kal-n-i
translation_as_in_source: the tall blind woman, tall blind women. the tall blind woman, tall blind women.
translation: the tall blind woman, tall blind women. the tall blind woman, tall blind women.
gloss: tall-nom blind woman-nom, tall-nom blind woman-pl-nom. tall-nom blind woman-nom, tall-pl-nom blind-pl-nom woman-pl-nom

comment: In Avar borrowings, instead of HPL and NPL agreement markers the borrowed Avar marker -l is sometimes used. On the other hand, the adjective 'thin' probably is not a borrowing? A lot of variation. The author believes that this process points at the attrition of original Godoberi HPL and NPL markers
example_as_in_source: ъажаиба / ъажаибал адамике, релларар/ релларал берке
example: ʕažaiba / ʕažaiba-l adamike, r-el:ara-r / r-el:ara-l berke
gloss: surprizing / surprizing-PL person.PL; NPL-thin-NPL / NPL-thin-PL snake.PL

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Unlike other Dargwa varieties, Kubachi Dargwa has gender agreement suffixes on adjectives, instead of number agreement
example_as_in_source: ara-zi-w adame, ara-žu-b adam-te. ara-zi-b h:āwan, ara-žu-d h:āwan-te
example: ara-zi-w adame, ara-žu-b adam-te. ara-zi-b h:āwan, ara-žu-d h:āwan-te
translation_as_in_source: здоровый мужчина, здоровые мужчины. здоровое животное, здоровые животные.
translation: healthy man, healthy men. healthy animal, healthy animals.
gloss: healthy-attr-m man, healthy-attr-hpl men. healthy-attr-n animal, healthy-attr-npl animals.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: When substantivized, adjectives can attach case, number and possessive marking

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives have 3 forms: 1) short without any marking, 2) form in -ssa which does not agree, 3) contrastive form in -ma/ -mur / -mi, that agrees in gender and number.
example_as_in_source: бучсса ниц, бучсса ницру. бучмур ниц, бучми ницру
example: butʃ-sːa nits, butʃ-sːa nits-ru. Butʃ-mur nits, butʃ-mi nits-ru
translation_as_in_source: жирный бык, жирные быки. жирный бык, жирные быки.
translation: fat ox, fat oxen. fat ox, fat oxen
gloss: fat-attr ox, fat-attr ox-pl. fat-atr.contr ox, fat-atr.contr.pl ox-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Unmarked adjectives are used in the attributive position and in the predicative position. Substantivized adjectives (SG -di, PL -bur(u)) are used in elliptical (anaphoric) contexts, predicative position and adjective-to-noun conversion

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: In Muni Andi no number agreement in the adnominal position.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Unlike other Dargwa varieties, Mehweb Dargwa does not have suffixal plural agreement on adjectives

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: In this dialect (except the idiom of Kishi) adjectives attach the plural marker encountered on nouns. Not clear, what happens with adjectives that end in -si / -(i)l

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives in -il, al, -an, gʷan are marked with -ti in plural. Adjectives in -na are marked with -bi. There are also non-agreeing adjectives, such as сахават 'generous', цӏуттара 'black', and genitives in -la
example_as_in_source: хулал/хулаг˚ан хъали, хулати хъудӏдӏи. бухъина ккалкка, духъинаби ккалккни.
example: χula-l/χula-ɡʷan qʰali, χula-ti qʰudӏdӏi. b-uqʰina k:alk:a, d-ux:ina-bi k:alk:-ni
translation_as_in_source: большая комната, большие комнаты. длинное дерево, длинные деревья.
translation: big room, big rooms. long tree, long trees.
gloss: big-attr / big attr room, big-attr.pl room.pl. n-thick tree, npl-thick-pl tree-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives that in Standard Dargwa end in -si, in Meusisha Dargwa end in -il (consonant-final root) or -el (vowel-final stem). In PL, most adjectives end in -ti, but those that in SG end in -a in PL end in -bi.
example_as_in_source: къугъати хӏавни. ухъна адам, бухънаби адамти
example: ɢuʁa-ti ħaw-ni. uqʰna adam, b-uqʰna-bi adam-ti
translation_as_in_source: красивые платья. старый человек, старые люди.
translation: beautiful dresses. old man, old men.
gloss: beautiful dress-pl. m.old dress, hpl-old dress-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: When substantivized, adjectives can attach case, number and possessive marking
translation_as_in_source: моя желтая рубашка, в твоих желтых рубашках
translation: my yellow shirt, in my yellow shirts

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives agree with the head of the NP in gender. The final vowel is not segmentable as a plural, since it arose due to the open syllable constraint (Denis Creissels p.c.)

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives agree with the head of the NP in gender. The final vowel is not segmentable as a plural, since it arose due to the open syllable constraint (Denis Creissels p.c.)

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: A part of adjectives agree for number: SG -si and -(i)l, PL -ti. If an adjective is bare or ends in -a, it does not agree.
example_as_in_source: way-si xabar, way-ti xabur-ti. xala-l yurt, xala-ti yurt-ani
example: way-si xabar, way-ti xabur-ti. xala-l yurt, xala-ti yurt-ani

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: A part of adjectives agree for number: SG -si and -(i)l, PL -ti. If an adjective is bare or ends in -a, -ar, -či, -kar, it does not agree.
example_as_in_source: ахӏси колхоз, ахӏти колхозуни. халал юрт, халати юртани
example: aħ-si kolχoz, aħ-ti kolχoz-uni. Χala-l jurt, χala-ti jurt-ani
translation_as_in_source: хороший колхоз, хорошие колхозы. большой дом, большие дома.
translation: good collective farm, good collective farms. big house, big houses
gloss: good-atr.sg collective_farm, good-atr.pl collective_farm-pl. big-attr.sg house, big-attr.pl house-pl

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives that in Standard Dargwa end in -si, in Myurego Dargwa often end in -il or -j. In SG and PL adjectives can be unmarked: short дукӏу хинкӏи 'тонкий хинкал', full дукӏу-те джузе 'тонкие книги'

value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives in the attributive position do not change, and when substantivized they do change

value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Short adjectives are used only as nominal modifiers, never as predicates or heads. Full adjectives (SG -ci, PL -ti) are used as predicates / heads and in the attributive position they have a restrictive / contrastive interpretation. -ci / -ti also attaches to other constituents as an attributivizer

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Short adjectives are used only as nominal modifiers, never as predicates or heads. Full adjectives (SG -ce, PL -te) are used as predicates / heads and attributes. No syntactic difference between -ce and -te in attributive position. -ce / -te also attaches to other constituents as an attributivizer
translation_as_in_source: big puddle of water, big targets
translation: big puddle of water, big targets

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives agree with the head of the NP in gender; it is dubious to analyze suffixal markers as number. Adjectives with gender prefixes and suffixes have the following marking: M.SG w-w, F.SG j-j, N.SG b-b, M.PL b-ij, F.PL b-aj, N.PL r-ij. Adjectives that have gender suffixes only (overall 6)  have the following marking: M.SG w, F.SG j, N.SG b, M.PL aj, F.PL aj, N.PL -ar.
example_as_in_source: инкIа-в ваша, инкIа-й йаше, инкIа-б чили. инкIикI-ай вашали, инкIикI-ай йашели, инкIикI-ар кванххелаби.
example: ink'a-w waʃa, ink'a-j jaʃe, ink'a-b tʃili. ink'ik'-aj waʃali, ink'ik'-aj jaʃeli, ink'ik'-ar kʷanχːelabi
translation_as_in_source: большой мальчик, большая девочка, большой дом. большие мальчики, большие девочки, большие рукава.
translation: big boy, big girl, big house. Big boys, big girls, big sleeves.
gloss: big-m boy, big-f girl, big-n house. Big-hpl boy-pl, big-hpl girl-pl, big-npl sleeve-pl.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: Adjectives marked for contrast (-il) agree for number (PL -te), and those not marked for contrast (-se) do not agree for number and even do not attach PL in the head position. But then the authors show that the matter is more complicated and -te is probably just plural rather than plural contrastive

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: In the atributive position adjectives do not agree, except for gender-number. In the predicative position they do agree.
example_as_in_source: аьхю кас, аьхю касар. аьхю хал, аьхю хулар.
example: äxü kas, äxü kasar. äxü xal, äxü xular.

comment: There is an attributive form in -n. If it is bare, it is analyzed as part of the NP. If it is marked for case and number, it is considered a separate NP.

value1_name: Is number marking present on adnominal adjectives?
value2_name: Conditioning of number marking on attributive adjectives
value3_name: How is number expressed on adnominal adjectives
value5_name: Distributive marking bordering on plural agreement
comment: In Andi gender and number agreement are expressed separately. All adjectives in attributive position agree for number. Sulejmanov considers -o to be the primary plural marker and -l the secondary marker.
example_as_in_source: в-о-чIедир гьекIа, й-е-чIедир й-еши, б-е-чIедир кьетIур, б-е-чIедир зи(н)в, р-е-чIедир ххуча, р-е-чIедир исирбесун. в-о-чIедир-о-л ъадам, й-е-чIедир-о-л й-еш-бо-л, б-е-чIедир-о-л кьетIур-ду-л, й-е-чIедир-о-л зин-о-л, р-е-чIедир-о-л ххуч-о-л, й-е-чIедир-о-л исирбесв-о(н)-л.
example: w-o-tʃ'edir hek'a, j-e-tʃ'edir j-eʃi, b-e-tʃ'edir tɬ'et'ur, b-e-tʃ'edir zi(n)w, r-e-tʃ'edir χːutʃa, r-e-tʃ'edir isirbesun. w-o-tʃ'edir-o-l ʔadam, j-e-tʃ'edir-o-l j-eʃ-bo-l, b-e-tʃ'edir-o-l tɬ'et'ur-du-l, j-e-tʃ'edir-o-l zin-o-l, r-e-tʃ'edir-o-l χːutʃ-o-l, j-e-tʃ'edir-o-l isirbesʷ-o(n)-l.

gloss: m-black man, f-black girl, n1-black tree, an-black cow, n2-black skin,book, n3-black hairsnake. M-black-pl man-pl, f-black-pl girl-pl, n1-black-pl tree-pl, an-black-pl cow-pl, n2-black-pl skin-pl,book-pl, n3-black-pl hairsnake-pl
